pull.title: rpc: Remove index-based Arg accessor
pull.body: The index-based Arg accessor is redundant with the name-based one. It does not provide any benefit to the code reader, or otherwise, so remove it.

events.body:

verification.payload:
tree bbb868867d5115bfbe19e9f70185e9ff096d0ca0
parent 42d5a1ff25a8045b6f4c09fa1fb71736dbccc034
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1714405147 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1715786474 +0200

rpc: Remove index-based Arg accessor

events.body: Code review ACK fa3169b0732d7eb4b9166e7ecc6b7cfb669a9b54. One changes since last review are some documentation improvements

comments.body:
In commit "rpc: Remove index-based Arg accessor" (fadb3eb57b4d207a678067b89caa45abf1f93702)

Should s/check_positional/check_named/
I think this means the positional `request.params` accessor, so this is better to leave as-is, no?

> I think this means the positional `request.params` accessor, so this is better to leave as-is, no?

I think this was called `check_positional` because it was calling the `Arg(size_t)` function and the the check below was called `check_named` because it was calling the `Arg(string_view)` function. So now that the check below is deleted and this now calling `Arg(string_view)`, it would make more sense to call this `check_named` than `check_positional`.

But the point of this is really to call the Arg method, so maybe a name like `check_args` would be better than either.

> I think this was called `check_positional` because ... 

Indeed, that was the rationale.

> so maybe a name like `check_args`

or `check_equivalence`? (no big deal either way ofc)

I am happy to review a follow-up, if there is a better name. But I think the current name is perfectly fine and accurate.

In any case, if the legacy code is removed, the test will go away as well.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -414,9 +414,7 @@ class RPCHelpMan
      * argument isNull() and parses (from JSON) and returns the user-passed argument,
      * or the default value derived from the RPCArg documentation.
      *
-     * There are two overloads of this function:
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(size_t i) to get the argument (or the default value) by index.
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
+     * Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
comments.body: nit: this is just the brief, so this line should be removed/merged imo (+ for MaybeArg)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -425,8 +423,9 @@ class RPCHelpMan
      * @see MaybeArg for handling optional arguments without default values.
      */
     template <typename R>
-    auto Arg(size_t i) const
comments.body:
nit: there's still a remaining reference to `Arg<Type>(i)` in `CheckRequiredOrDefault`:

<details>
<summary>git diff on fadb3eb57b</summary>

```diff
diff --git a/src/rpc/util.cpp b/src/rpc/util.cpp
index f683878054..d4079d9f37 100644
--- a/src/rpc/util.cpp
+++ b/src/rpc/util.cpp
@@ -673,7 +673,7 @@ static const UniValue* DetailMaybeArg(CheckFn* check, const std::vector<RPCArg>&
 
 static void CheckRequiredOrDefault(const RPCArg& param)
 {
-    // Must use `Arg<Type>(i)` to get the argument or its default value.
+    // Must use `Arg<Type>` to get the argument or its default value.
     const bool required{
         std::holds_alternative<RPCArg::Optional>(param.m_fallback) && RPCArg::Optional::NO == std::get<RPCArg::Optional>(param.m_fallback),
     };

```
</details>

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -414,9 +414,7 @@ class RPCHelpMan
      * argument isNull() and parses (from JSON) and returns the user-passed argument,
      * or the default value derived from the RPCArg documentation.
      *
-     * There are two overloads of this function:
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(size_t i) to get the argument (or the default value) by index.
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
+     * Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
comments.body:
Not sure what you mean. This sentence introduces the `Type`, which is referred to in the next sentence, so I don't think it can be removed.

Maybe you can share a diff?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -414,9 +414,7 @@ class RPCHelpMan
      * argument isNull() and parses (from JSON) and returns the user-passed argument,
      * or the default value derived from the RPCArg documentation.
      *
-     * There are two overloads of this function:
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(size_t i) to get the argument (or the default value) by index.
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
+     * Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
comments.body:
Ah good point, I hadn't considered that the `Type` alias is introduced here. I think a preferable approach to me is to use the actual `typename` instead of aliasing it, such as in this diff. Optionally, I'd also be supportive of renaming `R` to something more descriptive such as `ReturnType`, but even with just `R` I think this is more clear:

<details>
<summary>git diff on fadb3eb57b</summary>

```diff
diff --git a/src/rpc/util.h b/src/rpc/util.h
index 9ba7fcf5e6..8fc598b873 100644
--- a/src/rpc/util.h
+++ b/src/rpc/util.h
@@ -414,11 +414,9 @@ public:
      * argument isNull() and parses (from JSON) and returns the user-passed argument,
      * or the default value derived from the RPCArg documentation.
      *
-     * Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
+     * The instantiation of this helper for type R must match the corresponding RPCArg::Type.
      *
-     * The Type passed to this helper must match the corresponding RPCArg::Type.
-     *
-     * @return The value of the RPC argument (or the default value) cast to type Type.
+     * @return The value of the RPC argument (or the default value) cast to type R.
      *
      * @see MaybeArg for handling optional arguments without default values.
      */
@@ -446,12 +444,10 @@ public:
      * argument isNull() and parses (from JSON) and returns the user-passed argument,
      * or a falsy value if no argument was passed.
      *
-     * Use MaybeArg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the optional argument by key.
-     *
-     * The Type passed to this helper must match the corresponding RPCArg::Type.
+     * The instantiation of this helper for type R must match the corresponding RPCArg::Type.
      *
-     * @return For integral and floating-point types, a std::optional<Type> is returned.
-     *         For other types, a Type* pointer to the argument is returned. If the
+     * @return For integral and floating-point types, a std::optional<R> is returned.
+     *         For other types, a R* pointer to the argument is returned. If the
      *         argument is not provided, std::nullopt or a null pointer is returned.
      *
      * @see Arg for handling arguments that are required or have a default value.

```
</details>

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -425,8 +423,9 @@ class RPCHelpMan
      * @see MaybeArg for handling optional arguments without default values.
      */
     template <typename R>
-    auto Arg(size_t i) const
comments.body:
I was thinking that `i` means the key, as it is the symbol passed to the function.

Clarified in the latest push, by renaming `i` to `key`.

      * argument isNull() and parses (from JSON) and returns the user-passed argument,
      * or the default value derived from the RPCArg documentation.
      *
-     * There are two overloads of this function:
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(size_t i) to get the argument (or the default value) by index.
-     * - Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
+     * Use Arg<Type>(const std::string& key) to get the argument (or the default value) by key.
